snippet: Not only could competitors in China cut into its potential market share there, but Imax has charged in several courts that the Chinese system relies on technology that was blatantly stolen from its offices in Canada.
abstract: Imax Corporation has wary eye on Chinese market, where large-screen competitors have support of powerful government-owned company, China Film Group; Imax charges that not only could competitors in China cut into potential market share, but that Chinese system relies on technology that was blatantly stolen from its offices in Canada.

byline.contributor: David Barboza contributed reporting from Shanghai, and Brooks Barnes from New York.

lead_paragraph: Not only could competitors in China cut into its potential market share there, but Imax has charged in several courts that the Chinese system relies on technology that was blatantly stolen from its offices in Canada.

headline.main: Imax Faces a Threat in China
headline.print_headline: Imax Faces a Threat in China
